abstract: New York State Assemblyman James F Brennan, who supports effort to overhaul Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, rejects compromise bill suggested by Sen Thomas H Kean Jr of New Jersey; says bill is missing several key elements, like requirements to disclose compensation of top officers.
lead_paragraph: Assemblyman James F. Brennan of Brooklyn said that the bill did not include several elements that he felt were necessary, including requirements to disclose the compensation of top officers.

headline.main: New York Sponsor of Port Authority Reform Bill Rejects a New Jersey Compromise
headline.print_headline: Bistate Agreement Elusive on Port Authority Changes

snippet: Assemblyman James F. Brennan of Brooklyn said that the bill did not include several elements that he felt were necessary, including requirements to disclose the compensation of top officers.

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
